author: Not available
source: The Complete Corpus of Anglo-Saxon Poetry

text.0: Pater noster qui es in celis. Fæder manncynnes,      frofres ic þe bidde,
text.1: halig drihten,      þu ðe on heofonum eart.
text.4: þin nama nu ða,      neriende Crist,
text.6: Adueniat regnum tuum. Cume nu to mannum,      mihta wealdend,
text.7: þin rice to us,      rihtwis dema,
text.9: Fiat uolontas tua sicut in celo et in terra. on urum mode      mære þurhwunige.
text.10: And þin willa mid us      weorðe gelæsted
text.13: wynnum gewlitegod      a to worulde forð.
text.14: Panem nostrum cotidianum da nobis hodie. Syle us nu to dæge,      drihten gumena,
text.16: þone ðu onsendest      sawlum to hæle
text.18: þæt is se clæna      Crist, drihten god.
text.20: Forgyf us, gumena weard,      gyltas and synna,
text.21: and ure leahtras alet,      lices wunda
text.22: and mandæda,      swa we mildum wið ðe,
text.25: swa swa we forlætað      leahtras on eorþan
text.26: þam þe wið us      oft agyltað,
text.30: Ne læd þu us to wite      in wean sorge
text.32: þy læs we arlease      ealra þinra mildsa
text.35: And wið yfele gefreo      us eac nu ða
text.39: þæs ðe þu us milde      mihtum alysdest
